description: Jacqueline Sloan Ziegler, from Georgia, posted a cute video of the eager pooch on Facebook and it's now gone viral with nearly seven million views and more than 150,000 shares in just a few days.
title: Video shows a rescue pit bull dog try to copy a little girl's cartwheel
title_page: Video shows a rescue pit bull dog try to copy a little girl's cartwheel | Daily Mail Online
text:
They say you can't teach an old dog tricks but one clever rescue hound proved that theory wrong when he tried to copy a little girl cartwheeling.
Jacqueline Sloan Ziegler, from Georgia, posted the heart-warming video to Facebook and it's now gone viral with nearly seven million views and more than 150,000 shares in just a few days.
It shows a little girl called Kailyn showing off her cartwheeling skills, with 18-month-old dog Oakland, who was rescued by the family last year, rushing to try and copy her moves.
Scroll down for video
After watching Kailyn cartwheeling across the living room, Oakland prepares to try and do the same. Jacqueline Sloan Ziegler from Georgia posted the incredible video to Facebook and it's now gone viral with nearly 7 million views and more than 150,000 shares in just a few days
Dressed in a red jumper, the intelligent canine can be seen observing Kailyn who performs a series of elegant cartwheels before running and dipping his head down to the floor, before flipping himself over and then standing up again.
One might think it could have been a fluke, but the brown and white American pit bull recreates the move for a second time, to the amazement of his family.
The video has delighted the many people that have viewed it - with some calling for Oakland's incredible skills to be featured on the Ellen DeGeneres Show.
The brown and white American pit bull dips his head down onto the floor, before flipping himself over and standing up - to the amazement of his family who were videoing the moment
He is then shown trying to do a cartwheel for a second time - leaving Kailyn equally delighted, and she can be seen lying on the carpet next to him an rolling around on her back
Andi Orear said: 'That is the cutest and funniest thing!'
Emily Collins said: 'How precious! I giggle every time.'
Rebecca Yeager Corte added: 'This is so adorable!'
Jacqueline has now created a Facebook page for Oakland, saying she wants to raise awareness of his breed to help build dogs like him a more 'positive name'.
